posts.name: Combacsa
posts.cooked:
I came across this forum and the recent updates through a Reddit post.

In South Korea, some resellers began accepting pre-orders (with full payment) back in July 2025. It has now been two months since I completed my pre-order for two DGX Spark(4TB) with a ConnectorX cable, yet the reseller still has no clear information on when the product will be shipped.

After reading the posts here, I realize that the situation varies greatly depending on the region. I’ve seen announcements regarding the “Founders Edition” and the concept of “Secure,” which makes me wonder whether my reseller purchase is also considered “secured.”

As a global industry leader, I sincerely hope that NVIDIA can provide clearer updates and guidance to resellers in South Korea. This would help customers like myself feel more confident about our purchases and avoid uncertainty.

posts.name: Hartmut Jung
posts.cooked: The announcement of the DGX Spark in Jan 2025 and all the following updates are clearly indicating a kind of market manipulation. A big player offers in words only a truely genious package, but fails to deliver it. Very pitty.

Hopefully they are just resellers that reserved directly from NVIDIA.

See the note below from the Mods re: Alibaba which may be similar

Alibaba Selling the Spark already? DGX Spark / GB10
Hi, thank you for bringing this to our attention. This is not a legitimate listing. Tthe DGX Spark should be reserved from the NVIDIA marketplace or through one of our partners.

image888×943 78 KB

posts.name: Combacsa
posts.cooked:
@maiia Thank you for kind reply. In South Korea, it is NVIDIA Korea who lists legit resellers.

https://marketplace.nvidia.com/ko-kr/developer/dgx-spark/

Maybe I am using wrong term - “reseller”. “Reseller Partner”, maybe.

Anyway, it is 2025/09/23 10:40 AM KST here and the contact point of my purchase still claims that they would make it shipped within September, while another “listed” DGX Spark reseller posted that the delivery will be delayed until mid October.

Very confusing.

That’s a proper NVIDIA site @combacsa and you’re right it would be a NVIDIA South Korea Partner

If the Partner is communicating actual delivery dates projected for mid-October, that’s promising news. They would be in tune with relative supply chain timelines.

NVIDIA will want to have units in our hands before Oct 28th GTC preferably with first impressions starting to surface from the community.

It wouldn’t be a good look to announce in March promise for July and be on stage in October with an empty handed waitlist.

We’re hopefully in the final 3 - 4 week stretch.

If South Korea gets the units first please do share with us your first impressions! :)

posts.name: Combacsa
posts.cooked: Now it is Oct. 5th KST here. Having no updates from anyone from NVIDIA. I already made full payment with one of the reseller of NVIDIA, and it will be appreciated if fellow South Korean consumers got some updates.

posts.name: Combacsa
posts.cooked:
It is Oct 16th, and it seems that outside South Korea people are getting notified about the availability of DGX Spark.

But.

Though I already had made full purchase, I am not getting single detail of the shipment.

Maybe this forum is not a good place for those who ordered through NVIDIA Korea’s reseller partners.

Anyway, it will be highly appreciated if NVIDIA could give some sign(message) to NVIDIA Korea’s reseller partners so that could be delivered to those like myself.

posts.name: Combacsa
posts.cooked: Now I’ve just got a call from the reseller partner that they expect my DGX Sparks will be shipped around the end of this month, or maybe the end of next week.

posts.name: Combacsa
posts.cooked:
1761136455388756×749 89.8 KB

It is 2025/10/22 KST 21:34 here in South Korea. And finally I got two DGX Sparks.

posts.name: Combacsa
posts.cooked:

I’ve just started the very first setup now. Hope things goes very well.
